summary: Email chain among US Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff discussing an incident at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) where Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell with marks on his neck. The email notes Epstein was placed on suicide watch and mentions his cellmate Tartaglione.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Found unresponsive on the floor of his cell at MCC with red stretch marks on his neck; claims not to recall what happened and alleges threats from his bunkmate.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's bunkmate at MCC; claims he had headphones on and was not paying attention when Epstein was found unresponsive.

connections.description: Shared a cell at MCC; Epstein alleged Tartaglione had threatened him in the days prior to the incident.

events.title: Epstein found unresponsive in MCC cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found on the floor of his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, unresponsive but breathing, with red stretch marks along his neck.

events.title: Epstein placed on suicide watch
events.description: Following the incident, Epstein was placed on suicide watch per MCC protocol.

keyFacts: Epstein was found unresponsive in his MCC cell with red stretch marks on his neck, but breathing.
Epstein claimed he could not recall what happened and alleged his bunkmate Tartaglione had threatened him in recent days.
Tartaglione denied involvement, stating he was wearing headphones and not paying attention.
The MCC was investigating the incident and had placed Epstein on suicide watch.
US Attorney's Office staff discussed whether the FBI should be more active in the investigation.
